page.title: 07HORSE RACING
page.content: THE GT. YARMOUTH RACECOURSE Nowadays one complete round of the track covers a distance of two miles, enclosing 13.3 acres. It is said to have the flattest mile in the country. The Yarmouth course can stable about 100 horses. In one year about 15 races are held durint the summer season, with a minimum of 6 races in one day. Previously horses were transported from the Railway stations,but now lorries are used for the whole journey. Inside the track is part of the Gt. Yarmouth and Caister Golf Course. This land is rented from the race-course owners. Around the track there is about 6 miles of fencing. Some land is used for Summer touring caravans.
